meanings.definition: The act of passing across or through a place.
meanings.sent1: The transits of cars through the tunnel can cause traffic delays.
meanings.sent2: I watched the transits of birds flying overhead.
meanings.sent3: The transits of ants marching through the kitchen never fail to amuse me.
meanings.sent4: The transits of clouds across the sky create a constantly changing landscape.
meanings.sent5: The transits of students through the school hallways create a bustling atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The passage of a celestial body across the observer's meridian.
meanings.sent1: The astronomer observed the transits of planets through his telescope.
meanings.sent2: The transits of stars across the night sky are a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent3: The transits of comets through space always make me smile.
meanings.sent4: The transits of meteors across the atmosphere are like shooting stars.
meanings.sent5: The transits of moons across the horizon mark the passage of time.

meanings.definition: The conveyance of people or goods from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The transits of buses through the city ensure people reach their destinations.
meanings.sent2: The transits of ships across the ocean carry goods to different countries.
meanings.sent3: The transits of packages through the mail system can be surprisingly quick.
meanings.sent4: The transits of trains across the country connect cities and towns.
meanings.sent5: The transits of airplanes through the sky link continents together.
